pr_title: HIVE-24157: Strict mode to fail on CAST timestamp <-> numeric

timeline.bodyText: Could we add a comment to the class?
timeline.author: jcamachor

timeline.bodyText: Can we add a couple of negative tests on column ref instead of constant? And/or with some complex expressions?
timeline.author: jcamachor

replies.bodyText: I've added a few more tests; and I've also added one with a struct - however I don't really feel it that much different from the others (the way the check works) - I might be too much "inside the box"; so if you have any suggestions what tests to add - please let me know
replies.author: kgyrtkirk

replies.bodyText: Maybe a couple with a comparison timestamp and numeric (e.g., = or <) which should lead to a cast to double being introduced (yeah, comparison is effectively done in double) and then the query failing.
replies.author: jcamachor

replies.bodyText:
good catch! I didn't expected that = will work without casting - but since its using the converters it could avoid these checks.
I considered moving the check into the converters - however that would involved getting a SessionState in serde codes...so I instead added 1 more check to cover all the comparisions. Generic binary operator seem to don't auto-convert things ; + was complaining about adding a timestamp and an integer - so I think we are good.
replies.author: kgyrtkirk
